ECONAZOLE NITRATE

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Side effects
  • Cautions
  • conception and contraception
  • Unlicensed use
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Fungal skin infections,

To the skin

  • For adults
    Apply twice daily.
  • For children
    Apply twice daily.

Fungal nail infections,

By transungual application

  • For adults
    Apply once daily, applied under occlusive dressing.
  • For children
    Apply once daily, applied under occlusive dressing.

Advice when patient is pregnant

With topical use

Minimal absorption from skin; not known to be harmful.

With vaginal use

Pregnant women need a longer duration of treatment, usually about 7 days, to clear the infection.

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Occasional local irritation,

Specific side effects

notKnown: burning sensation, erythema, hypersensitivity reactions, itching,

With topical use

Treatment should be discontinued if side-effects are severe.

Cautions regarding administration

  • With topical use: avoid contact with eyes and mucous membranes
  • With vaginal use: avoid intravaginal preparations (particularly those that require use of an applicator) in young girls who are not sexually active, unless there is no alternative in children

Advice regarding conception and contraception

With vaginal use

Cream and pessaries damage latex condoms and diaphragms.

Unlicensed use

With topical use in children

Pevaryl , no age range specified by manufacturer.

Prepared medicinal forms of ECONAZOLE NITRATE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: eye drops,
Pessary
Cream
